column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18278 (interfaces: Describe and follow some code conventions by ryanofsky)
* #17954 (wallet: Remove calls to Chain::Lock

Rebased and substantially refocused this PR to:
* Return `ScanResult` from `RescanFromTime`
* Add `ScanResult::FailedTime` to report the best non-failing time - beneficial also because most callers are uninterested in the time
* Drop ~`IsScanning` and~ `IsAbortingRescan` from `CWallet`, as all scan/abort status is now returned as results from specific operations.
Rebased
looks like a nice refactor\n\nutACK 4b4cf7cc28347b2d537be89a412093dbd62ea83e
Rebased, and restored `IsScanning` as it's needed for d3e8458365

not sure why github tends to screw up range-diffs sometimes but here's the last one:

```
$ git range-diff 4b4cf7c~2..4b4cf7c 469117d~2..469117d
```
```diff
1:  99a72728a6 = 1:  c82f6c7806 Return ScanResult from CWallet::RescanFromTime
2:  4b4cf7cc28 ! 2:  469117d55c Make scan / abort status private to CWallet
@@ -2,7 +2,7 @@
 
     Make scan / abort status private to CWallet\
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->\nðŸ™ This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).
Any plans for this? It's needed rebase for more than a year, no other activity.

This is a dead store since `nTimeBegin` is unconditionally written to on L573.\n\nPerhaps you could drop the dead store and instead move the `nTimeBegin = chainActive.Tip()->GetBlockTime();` to the line after `LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);`?
`nTimeBegin` is used outside that block for the rescan, line 646.\nI prefer to leave this as it seems harmless. Alternative is leaving it uninitialized.
Gotcha, I'd rather leave as is, as the change is pretty well orthogonal.
Now that this method doesn't return a timestamp (`int64_t`) anymore, this Doxygen comment needs to be updated.
Updated, thanks!
Tiny preference of `switch (result.status)` versus `if`'ing over enums (e.g. it gives compiler warnings when new fields are added).
Add empty (` *`) line before @ return. (See "Coding Style (Doxygen-compatible comments)" in developer.nodes.md)
This feels weird to me, and feels like it should have a new `ORPHAN_CHAIN` `ScanResult`, even if this is handled the same way as `SUCCESS` everywhere right now.
This differs from the original code, where `scannedTime` was set to the last block time + `TIMESTAMP_WINDOW + 1`. Won't this result in missed scans below, as `scannedTime` will be low?
Looks like you could have a race in this method?

I don't see the difference in behavior - see the original location for comparison: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14942/commits/f059899fe3ca88204d9dda4f83c4f8c4548743ea#diff-b2bb174788c7409b671c46ccc86034bdL1607-L1611\n\nCould you call out what you're referring to any more explicitly, in terms of what has changed?
No, sorry, you're right. I missed the passing of `scannedTime` on L#1427. It looks identical.
Why does it matter the return value? Isn't even documented.

It's a bit convoluted, but I think it's handled gracefully: if `fScanningWallet` is set to `false` as `fAbortRescan` is being set to `true` (i.e. at the end of a scan), there is no issue as `ScanForWalletTransactions` sets `fAbortRescan` to `false` at its start.\n\nBTW this behavior is unchanged - here's the prior implementation: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14942/files#diff-522490d83
